function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Deployment of new technologies in urban environments may lead to disruptions in infrastructure and services.","Impact":"Increased risk of service outages and infrastructure failures in the event of technological malfunctions or cyber attacks.","Mitigation":"Routine maintenance and cybersecurity measures must be implemented to minimize the risk of disruptions.","Technologies":"Advanced monitoring systems and cybersecurity protocols.","People":"Citizens, businesses, and public service providers.","Owner":"Government agencies, technology companies."},{"Description":"Increased reliance on digital technologies may result in data privacy and security vulnerabilities.","Impact":"Risk of personal data breaches, identity theft, and unauthorized surveillance, leading to loss of privacy and trust.","Mitigation":"Strict data protection regulations, encryption protocols, and privacy-aware design of technologies must be enforced.","Technologies":"Secure data encryption, privacy-enhancing technologies, and compliance management systems.","People":"Citizens, consumers, and data subjects.","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, technology providers, and data controllers."},{"Description":"Heavy reliance on technology for pandemic response may lead to over-reliance and complacency in traditional health and safety measures.","Impact":"Reduced emphasis on traditional public health interventions and preparedness strategies, leading to potential gaps in disease control.","Mitigation":"Integrated approach that balances technological solutions with conventional public health measures and emergency preparedness.","Technologies":"IoT devices, digital surveillance, and traditional public health infrastructure.","People":"Health authorities, public health practitioners, and government officials.","Owner":"Health organizations, government agencies, and public health institutions."}]}
